channel.title: Nix on Miaulog
channel.description: Recent content in Nix on Miaulog

item.title: Dokuwikiで日本語PDFを出力したかった
item.description:
CentOS6.6, Dokuwiki Hrun、Dw2Pdf_20150622でのこと。

そのままでも一応日本語は出力されるが、中国語フォントだったり、豆腐になったりしたので、いろいろやらなきゃならなかった。

item.title: The workflow for my thesis
item.description:
Overview

  1. Write thesis body in Pandoc Markdown.
  2. Build latex sources and pdf using Waf build system.
    1. Do with thesis pandoc template file if you need.

item.title: Haskell: Installing ghc without root privilege
item.description: Get OS specific “Binary Packages” $cd /home/foo $wget http://www.haskell.org/ghc/dist/7.0.4/ghc-7.0.4-x86_64-unknown-linux.tar.bz2 $tar -xvf ghc-7.0.4-x86_64-unknown-linux.tar.bz2 Configure and install as usual $cd ghc-7.0.4 $./configure --prefix=/home/foo/usr #something like this... $make install Notes You will obviously need to install cabal from somewhere else… Using haskell-platform will make it easier. $cd /home/foo $wget http://lambda.haskell.org/platform/download/2011.4.0.0/haskell-platform-2011.4.0.0.tar.gz $cd haskell-platform-2011.4.0.0 $./configure --prefix=/home/foo/usr $make $make install Reference: Stackoverflow

item.title: Byobu: an useful metacommand for gnu screen
item.description: Notes Byobu probably doesn’t work well on Mac OSX (e.g. via Homebrew or build from source) In my case, newt-python and some libraries are missing. (byobu 5.5) This commands would be different in the latest versions of byobu, since I could only use byobu 2.68 with screen 4.00. Starting byobu $byobu as the same as screen command. Basic commands: Escape sequence is ctrl+a by default though it can be changed in the configuration dialogue (press F9).

item.title: GNU screen: Run your commands even sudden connection lost occurs
item.description: Assuming your system is Unix like systems, and screen is installed. Create sessions $screen (introduction will appear) press enter Basic commands C-a c: create new session C-a w: show current sessions C-a [0-Z]: move to other sessions C-a d: detach screen C-a k: kill screen Restoring sessions if connection lost occurs $screen -ls: which shows list of screen sessions like this: There are screens on: pid.

item.title: Solving Permission Denied
item.description:
Problem

When logging in to server using public key authentication, I couldn’t log in.
